adjectives.description: tubercular (comparative more tubercular, superlative most tubercular)

entries.meaning: Of, pertaining to, or having tuberculosis.
examples: As he grew older, his tubercular thinness tended toward emaciation.

entries.meaning: Relating to or reminiscent of the wheezing sounds associated with the breathing of tuberculosis patients.
examples: The engine heaved.  […]  The thing sounded like a tubercular tugboat engine without a muffler.
“ORANGE ORCHID” “SPOTTED ORCHID”  […]  Dorsal appendage of the hood of column smooth, tubercular and notched at the end.
They are the tuberculars, the psychiatrics, and the older men suffering from chronic conditions. All of those men are totally disabled.
